intro: Bupleurum glumaceum var. pichleri, commonly known as the Pichler's Bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
